title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Billionaire Richard Branson reached the edge of space on a Virgin Galactic rocket plane that took off -- from near which town?

A. Carefree, Ariz.

B. Uncertain, Texas

C. Pahrump, Nev.

D. Truth or Consequences, N.M.

---

2. Johnson & Johnson is recalling most Neutrogena and Aveeno spray sunscreens from U.S. stores after finding what in some samples?

A. Benzene

B. Cadmium

C. Plutonium

D. Silica dust

---

3. The British Open got underway. Golfers convened in what community?

A. Barley

B. Rye

C. Sandwich

D. Bangor

---

4. World Trade Organization head Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala hopes to conclude an agreement among member nations on subsidies -- for what?

A. Oil

B. Steel

C. Fishing

D. Quinoa

---

5. In South Africa, reeling from the pandemic, riots erupted after the arrest of a politician. Which one?

A. Jacob Zuma

B. Cyril Ramaphosa

C. F.W. de Klerk

D. Thabo Mbeki

---

6. Apparently for the first time, scientists decoded full words by reading the mind of a paralyzed person unable to speak. Where did the breakthrough occur?

A. University of Southern California

B. University of California, San Francisco

C. Stanford University

D. UCLA

---

7. Elon Musk said that he doesn't enjoy managing Tesla and would prefer to do something else. What?

A. Enter a religious order

B. Race electric cars

C. Design and engineering

D. Become a mime

---

8. Microsoft is launching a new, cloud-based version of Windows. What's it called?

A. Windows Cumulus

B. Windows Anywhere

C. Windows 365

D. Windows Off Base

---

9. Coffee prices are soaring. Why?

A. Insatiable demand

B. Drought in Brazil

C. Port delays in Colombia and Vietnam

D. All of the above

---

ANSWERS

1. D

2. A

3. C

4. C

5. A

6. B

7. C

8. C

9. D
